title: Senators’ Vote Clears the Way for Debate on New Gun Laws
summary: The threat of a filibuster fell to a 68-31 vote. The Senate next week will consider its first major gun-control legislation in two decades, which would expand background checks and add penalties for criminal sales.

title: For Swing-State Democrats, Perils on Gun Control
summary: For years, guns have been an issue for swing-state Democrats to avoid. But many Democrats say recent shootings have changed the politics of guns.

title: Online Currency Draws Big Investors
summary: The Winklevoss twins, known as nemeses of Mark Zuckerberg, have what seems to be one of the largest portfolios of the bitcoin.

title: South Korea Eases Tone on Bellicose Neighbor
summary: South Korea softened its tone on Thursday amid concerns that North Korean missile tests are imminent, and its president moved to calm foreign investors.

title: Automakers Recall 3.3 Million Vehicles Over Air Bags
summary: Honda, Toyota, Nissan and Mazda are recalling about 3.3 million vehicles worldwide because the passenger-side air bag could deploy with too much force.

title: N.H.L. Announces Initiative to Support Gay Athletes
summary: The N.H.L. has formed a partnership with an advocacy group pledged to fight homophobia in sports, and plans training and counseling on gay issues for its teams and players.

title: Fleet Week Is Threatened by Federal Budget Cuts
summary: New York City officials and military representatives are preparing for a Fleet Week that will be significantly reduced if it occurs at all.

title: Sometimes, Riders Find a Cabby Worth Praising
summary: About twice a day, taxi passengers in New York have something nice to say about their cabbies — taking the unusual step of filing a compliment with the city.

title: Live Updates on the Masters
summary: Live blogging of the first round of the 77th Masters on Thursday, with eyes on Tiger Woods and Rory McIlroy.

title: Turkish Police Say U.S. Embassy Was Target of Bomb Plot
summary: Twelve are arrested in an alleged Al-Qaeda-linked plot to attack the embassy in Ankara, a synagogue in Istanbul and other targets.
